# space-separated-tokens

[![Build][build-badge]][build]
[![Coverage][coverage-badge]][coverage]
[![Downloads][downloads-badge]][downloads]

Parse and stringify space-separated tokens, following the WHATWG spec.

## What is this?

This package parses and stringifies space-separated tokens, as commonly used in HTML's `class` attribute, according to the [WHATWG specification][spec].  It's a small, focused utility.

## When should I use this?

This package is most useful when working with structured data that needs to be represented as space-separated tokens, such as in processing HTML content, particularly with libraries like [hast][].

## Install

This package is ESM only.

In Node.js (version 14.14+ or 16.0+):

```bash
npm install space-separated-tokens
```

In Deno using `esm.sh`:

```typescript
import { parse, stringify } from 'https://esm.sh/space-separated-tokens@2'
```

In browsers using `esm.sh` (and bundling):

```html
<script type="module">
  import { parse, stringify } from 'https://esm.sh/space-separated-tokens@2?bundle'
  // ... use the functions here
</script>
```

## Usage

```javascript
import { parse, stringify } from 'space-separated-tokens';

const parsed = parse(' foo\tbar\nbaz  ');
console.log(parsed); // Output: ['foo', 'bar', 'baz']

const stringified = stringify(['foo', 'bar', 'baz']);
console.log(stringified); // Output: 'foo bar baz'
```

## API

This package exports the `parse` and `stringify` functions.  There is no default export.

### `parse(value)`

Parses a space-separated string (`string`) into an array of strings (`Array<string>`), handling whitespace according to the [WHATWG spec][spec].

### `stringify(values)`

Serializes an array of strings or numbers (`Array<string|number>`) into a space-separated string (`string`).  Important: Empty or whitespace-only values are not allowed.

## Types

This package is strongly typed with TypeScript.  No additional type declarations are exported.

## Compatibility

This package is compatible with all maintained versions of Node.js (14.14+ and 16.0+), Deno, and modern browsers.

## Related

*   [`comma-separated-tokens`](https://github.com/wooorm/comma-separated-tokens): for comma-separated tokens.
*   [`collapse-white-space`](https://github.com/wooorm/collapse-white-space): for collapsing multiple whitespace characters.
*   [`property-information`](https://github.com/wooorm/property-information): for accessing information about HTML properties.
